greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{n >= 1, b(n) != 1} 1/b(n)^n, where b(n) = A217626(n).
comment: Decimal expansion of the limit to which tends the difference between the series for 1/A217626(x) and the Gamma function evaluated for M, where 2<M and 1<=x<M!. - _R. J. Cano_, May 25 2017
link: R. J. Cano, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..4999
mathematica: First@ RealDigits@ N[#, 108] &@ Total@Map[1/#1^#2 & @@ # &, DeleteCases[ MapIndexed[{#1, First@ #2} &, #], _?(First@ # == 1 &)]] &@ Differences@ Flatten@ Table[(Drop[#, If[m == 1, 0, (m - 1)!]] - First@ #)/9 &@ Map[FromDigits, Permutations@ Range@ m], {m, 7}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 25 2017, after _Jean-François Alcover_ at A215940 *)
results.author: _R. J. Cano_, Dec 02 2012
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 03 2012
